Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib

Class PreciseMovement

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.PreciseMovement
public class PreciseMovement extends Object
Autonomous movement. This being static could make it broken. Further testing is needed. It may have to be turned into an object you initialize. Note: Since we literally don't have encoders plugged into our motors, the code in here should always use updateDeadWheelPos() instead of deadWheelPos(). Won't change in case I'm wrong.

  • Method Details

    • preciseMovementInit

      public static void preciseMovementInit()
      Initialize the starting values. Must be called after RobotHardwareInit().
      See Also:
      • RobotHardware

    • moveToPos

      public static boolean moveToPos(double targetPosX, double targetPosY, double iterationTime)
      attempts to move the robot to the given position
      Parameters:
      targetPosX - the x position you want to robot to move to
      targetPosY - the y position you want the robot to move to
      iterationTime - delta-time between now and last loop. Used for the PIDs
      Returns:
      whether or not the current position is less than movement tolerance

    • turnToAngle

      public static boolean turnToAngle(double targetAngle, double iterationTime)
      attempts to move the robot closer to a target angle from its current angle
      Parameters:
      targetAngle - the angle the robot should be facing
      iterationTime - delta-time between now and last loop. Used for the PIDs
      Returns:
      whether or not the current angle is within the angle tolerance

    • updatePos

      public static void updatePos()
      Updates the position of the robot. Uses all 4 motor encoders to do this. Finds the delta of encoder value of the motors and turns this into a vector. Adds these vectors together to find the change in the robots position. Adds this change to the current position to find the updated current position of the robot.

    • updateDeadWheelPos

      public static double[] updateDeadWheelPos()
      Updates the position of the robot using deadwheel encoders
      Returns:
      returns current position of dead wheels for TESTING purposes. Return can be gotton rid of after.

    • distanceFromPos

      public static double distanceFromPos(double targetPosX, double targetPosY)
      finds the distance between the current and target robot positions
      Parameters:
      targetPosX - the x target position
      targetPosY - the y target position
      Returns:
      the distance between the current and target robot positions

    • getPos

      public static double[] getPos()
      gets the current position
      Returns:
      returns the current x and y position

    • setMovementTolerance

      public static void setMovementTolerance(double t)
      sets movement tolerance
      Parameters:
      t - tolerance you want for distance from currentPosition to targetPosition. (How precise the movement has to be)

    • setAngleTolerance

      public static void setAngleTolerance(double t)
      sets angle tolerance
      Parameters:
      t - tolerance you want for distance from currentAngle to targetAngle. (How precise the turning has to be)

    • setMovementPID

      public static void setMovementPID(double kp, double kd, double ki)
      sets the Kp, Kd, and Ki values of the PID for the movement of the robot. This control the the curve of how it approaches a target position.
      Parameters:
      kp - Increasing this makes the robot move to the target position in a more proportional matter. It will move faster when further from the target position and slower when closer
      kd - This makes the robot slow down if it reaches the targetPosition to quickly by adding a negative force.
      ki - This makes the robot speed up if it does not move to the targetPosition quick enough

    • setAnglePID

      public static void setAnglePID(double Kp, double Kd, double Ki)
      sets the Kp, Kd, and Ki values of the PID for the movement of angle turning of the robot. This control the the curve of how it turns to a target angle
      Parameters:
      Kp - Increasing this makes the robot move to the target angle in a more proportional matter. It will move faster when further from the target angle and slower when closer
      Kd - This makes the robot slow down if it reaches the target angle to quickly by adding a force in the opposite direction.
      Ki - This makes the robot speed up if it does not move to the target angle quick enough
